subject: Re: Fwd: [Action required] Security update for the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway
preview: Okay thanks for updating and improving the process. Good to hear WooCommerce is now part of maintenance schedule.

full_threads.body: Okay thanks for updating and improving the process. Good to hear WooCommerce is now part of maintenance schedule.

Hi @allieB,

Thank you for the detailed update and for addressing this so promptly. I really appreciate the context on why WooCommerce updates were handled cautiously in the past, and it’s great to see a proactive SOP and tracking system now in place. This gives me a lot of confidence that client sites will remain both safe and up to date. Thanks again to you and @joel for taking the lead on this.

Hi @andy ,

Jumping in here for Manuel, thank you for letting us know:

Here’s what happened and how we’re handling it:
  • The plugin was overlooked because we typically don’t update WooCommerce during routine care plan cycles unless we're sure it's safe.
  • Some sites have previously broken after WooCommerce updates, so we’ve been extra cautious about when and how we apply them.
  • That said, we recognize the gap and have already taken steps to address it proactively.

Going forward:
We’ve decided to start including WooCommerce updates in our care plans so we can ensure all client sites are up to date and secure.

Next steps:
  • I just had a quick huddle with Joel to create a new SOP specifically for WooCommerce updates.
  • This SOP will guide the team on when and how to safely proceed with these updates.
    We’re also setting up a shared Google Sheet to track:
    • Which sites can safely update WooCommerce
    • Which sites shouldn’t be updated (with reasons noted)

Here’s the ClickUp task link for visibility: WooCommerce Update SOP – ClickUp

Let me know if there’s anything else you’d like us to include, we’ve got it moving on our end.

@manuel - can you see why this was overlooked by us?

Customers rely on us to keep plugins updated and unsure what the gap was here.

Thank you

Hi Darren,

Thank you so much for letting us know!

Just confirming that we've gone ahead and updated the WooCommerce plugin.

Let us know if anything else comes up or if you need a hand with anything else. Always happy to help!

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena
Allie Borcena assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi,

I received this today, is it possible for Wolf IQ to update please.

Thank You.


Begin forwarded message:

From: Stripe <notifications@stripe.com>
Subject: [Action required] Security update for the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway
Date: 14 August 2025 at 14:39:20 AEST
To: darren_robinson@me.com
Reply-To: Stripe <notifications@stripe.com>
Hello,
In 2025, you processed payments using an old version of the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway. Stripe now requires a security update for this plugin. You'll need to update your plugin version to at least 9.8 and re-authenticate using Stripe by 15 October 2025, to continue getting essential performance and feature enhancements.
Updating requires no code changes and takes only a few minutes.
The updated plugin also includes Stripe Optimized Checkout Suite, a payments experience optimised for conversion. It also includes popular payment methods, AI models that dynamically show the most relevant payment methods to optimise conversion, and Link, a wallet built by Stripe.
Next steps
Sign in to the WordPress Admin Dashboard and make the requested changes:
1.
Update your plugin: From the sidebar, go to the Plugins page. Click Update available, then find and update the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway.
2.
Re-authenticate: Go to the Payments tab in your WooCommerce settings. Click the Stripe payment method, then go to the Settings tab. Click Re-authenticate.
3.
Turn on the Optimized Checkout Suite: Go back to the Payments tab in your WooCommerce settings page. Click the Stripe payment method. Under Advanced settings, select Enable Optimised Checkout Suite and save the changes.
4.
Test the changes.
These instructions above only apply to the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway, which you may have downloaded from the WordPress Plugin directory or WooCommerce Marketplace.
If you no longer use the plugin
If you don't use the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway, for your security, follow the documentation to disconnect the plugin and remove the Stripe API keys.
If you have any questions, please visit our support page or reply to this email and a WooCommerce Happiness Engineer will be glad to help.
- The Stripe and WooCommerce teams
Stripe emails you about important updates, like plugin requirements. If you no longer use the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway in your site, you can disregard this email. If you have an account located in the EEA/UK: Stripe Payments Europe, Limited is an Irish limited company with registered number 513174 and a registered office at 3 Dublin Landings, North Wall Quay, Dublin 1, D01 C4E0, Ireland.
This email relates to your ShellShocked Media Stripe account.
Account ID: acct_1CttvzI18U69oLDH
Need to refer to this message? Use this ID: em_6klg7sztt5oqeqndsojezr4n0j4cku
Stripe, 354 Oyster Point Blvd, South San Francisco, CA 94080

Darren Robinson
0417445075
https://shellshockedmedia.com
